description.p: The Modulous and individual Modulons are creatures made of ambition. They are custom made constructed intelligences, capable of everything any other race is capable of, and sometimes more. Where each member of a race shares similar traits there are very few shared between Modulons, even that which is common, such as their construct nature is not certain. The only certainty is their origin, a Modulon is created by magic, a complex ritual infusing a quasi-soul into a constructed form. Other than that, each form and soul are unique.

Each Modulon is created by one or more creators, they do not naturally exist. The first of the Modulons were made from scraps of armour pulled together from fallen soldiers and then enchanted to keep fighting when they were needed, due to their nature some of these Modulons are still pulling their half-decayed forms around the world of Emanon, however they are far rarer than their newer cousins, who are made of custom pieces rather than whatever was at hand.

A Modulon is often given a mission or task at time of creation, often something like "protect this person" or "explore this place" or "destroy this thing" these often serve as catalysts for the new consciousnesses to develop into rounded creatures through a quest or task. Once this task is deemed complete, whether because they succeeded, or failed, or just gave up which though rare can happen, they will often spend a long period of time trying to find new purpose, sometimes finding it in a mystery they found along their first journey, sometimes just wondering around until they find something interesting enough.

The science behind morality is still a puzzle to most, where a quasi-consciousness can be constructed through arcane equations, giving an intelligence close enough to a normal race to pass as a full creature, a moral compass is far rarer. This is not to say it is impossible, but is to say that the majority of Modulons are apathetic to the vast majority of things, but can sometimes find fascination in the simplest things.

Modulons are created creatures, as such their names vary as wide as the creatures capable of creating Modulons. Ancient Modulons tend towards simpler names, being unimportant tools, whereas purpose built newer models often have far more character part of which comes through a more natural name.
As a Modulon you gain the following traits:

Modular Construction All Modulon Traits come from what goes into making them, as such other than a few suggested traits there are no defining traits for a Modulon, as such when creating a Modulon you are given 12 points to spend, you can increase or decrease this through talks with your DM but 12 is the default. Each trait will have a point value assigned to it from 1+ the total value of all of the traits may not exceed your set max, default 12, however other than this there are no rules about how they may be spent, this reflects the totally custom feel of a Modulon.
Age. Modulons are created lifeforms, as such they do not age but keep existing as long as their consciousness is contained
Alignment. Modulons are often created Neutral, as anything other than this is too complex for most to craft, however life experience or random mistakes can change this.
Size. Modulons are often created to at least resemble Humanoid creatures, however your size is a buyable trait
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet, however this is modifiable through buyable traits

Free Traits. There are some free traits in the list, these are not required however they are the standard traits that would be expected in a race alongside unique traits, as such there is no cost to them, however they are still optional.

There are two types of Modulon, Ancient Modulons and Modern Modulons. They reflect the two time periods in which Modulons were created and the traits available to them reflect the technological advancements and the focus on what a Modulon of that time period was designed to do.

Ancient Modulons are far older than their modern counterparts. They tend closer towards neutral as morality was useless to explore for the creators of the time. They are often made from cobbled together scraps of metal armour and other things that could be found. These Modulons tend to be hardier and more combat oriented than their modern counterparts. Additionally they tend to lack magical weapons or abilities as this was too much effort, though weaker magical powers can still be found in a few of them.

Modern Modulons are the newer specifications, they often come with custom built parts, with consciousnesses capable of complex moral decisions, and more in depth personalities. They're abilities tend to stray away from combat orientation and magical abilities are far more common. Additionally they tend to have more ornate designs, lots of time and care often goes into a modern modulon though there are still a few made of piecemeal equipment.

All Modulon Traits come from what goes into making them, as such other than a few suggested traits there are no defining traits for a Modulon, as such when creating a Modulon you are given 12 points to spend, you can increase or decrease this through talks with your DM but 12 is the default. Each trait will have a point value assigned to it, the total value of all of the traits may not exceed your set max, default 12, however other than this there are almost no rules about how they may be spent, this reflects the totally custom feel of a Modulon, some traits don't work together such as darkvision and superior darkvision as superior darkvision overwrites darkvision. (Note there will always be some selects available as they have a negative value, as they are penalties rather than benefits, these are optional and do not need to be selected.)

description.p: Gives your Modulon a Fire based Breath Attack. You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. This produces a 15 foot cone dealing 2d6 fire damage. A creature caught in this attack must make a dexterity saving throw, your DC for this is 8 + your proficiency modifier + your constitution modifier. A creature takes full damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th and 5d6 at 16th. After you use your breath weapon, you can’t use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

description.p: Perfects your Modulons construct nature. Even though you were constructed, you are a living creature. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.

description.p: Gives your Modulon 30ft Flying speed. You additionally have wings, you must be in a space wide enough to accommodate your wingspan to fly. Your wingspan is equal to twice your height. You cannot fly if you are wearing armor you are not proficient in, armor not tailored to accommodate your wings, or a backpack not specially tailored to your wings. You fall to the ground at the end of your turn unless you move at least half your fly speed during your turn. Additionally if you take damage whilst flying you must succeed a concentration check to stay airborne, on a failed save you begin to fall.

Additionally if you take damage whilst flying you must succeed a concentration check to stay airborne, on a failed save you begin to fall.
